intro: Thalictrum minus proles schleicheri, commonly known as the lesser meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a slender, upright stem and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
